intro: Eritrichium lineare, commonly known as the slender eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its linear leaves and small, clustered flowers make it a distinctive species within its habitat. Eritrichium lineare is often found in rocky or gravelly areas, where it thrives in cooler, high-altitude climates.
